channel.title: What type of download? i386, etc
channel.description:
I have 2 computers, one is a laptop and one is a desktop, and I am wondering what version (i368, etc) should I use for it, and what distro, the appropriate drivers, etc.
[b]Desktop[/b] [u]Model:[/u] Emachine EL1200-05w [u]Processor:[/u] AMD Athlon 2650e Processor ( and on the sticker it says AMD Athlon at the top and 64 at the bottom) [u]Processor Speed:[/u] 1.61 GHz [u]RAM:[/u] 1GB [u]Graphics Card:[/u] Nividia GeForce 6150SE nForce 430 (integrated) [u]Graphics Memory:[/u] 512MB [u]Chipset:[/u] Nividia GeForce 6150SE nForce 430 (integrated) [i](I believe most Linux Distros don't have my chipset driver so Ethernet won't work until it does)[/i] [u]System Type:[/u] I believe 32-bit but I don't know how to check in XP
[b]Laptop[/b] [u]Model:[/u] HP Pavilion dv6500 [u]Laptop Processor:[/u] Intel(R) Pentium(R) Dual CPU T2330 @ 1.60GHz 1.60 GHz [u]Processor Speed:[/u] 2 processors with 1.60 GHz [u]Graphics:[/u] Some kind of Intel Graphics (integrated) [u]Graphics Memory:[/u] 128MB [u]Wireless:[/u] Some kind of Broadcom (integrated) [u]Chipset:[/u] Mobile Intel(R) 965 Express Chipset Family [u]System Type:[/u] 32 Bit
And I don't know what is the best type to have it run off of. Because I have been having a few issues such as graphic issues and

item.title: What type of download? i386, etc
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

Thanks, Kubuntu gives me weird graphics problems. I chose Sabayon, it has KDE 3.5 but it had my wireless driver and graphics card driver right away.

Read full topic
item.source: What type of download? i386, etc

item.title: What type of download? i386, etc
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Your desktop will support amd64 (same as x64, x86_64, etc) but will still run x86 (i386, i486, i686). I would recommend x86 as it is more compatible and will give you less headaches with quite a few things if you are just starting out. Also with linux, the drivers are included in the kernel, so as long as your hardware is supported it will most likely just work out of the box.

Lastly, I recommend Kubuntu (although I’m sticking with the 8.04 release because I like KDE 3.5, and not 4)

Read full topic
item.source: What type of download? i386, etc

item.title: What type of download? i386, etc
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

pick whatever distro you want. I like arch but for some its complicated.

you can use i386, i486, i586, i686, but aim for i686 as it will be faster.

Read full topic

item.title: What type of download? i386, etc
item.dc:creator: @bjc22 bjc22
item.description:
@bjc22 wrote:

I have 2 computers, one is a laptop and one is a desktop, and I am wondering what version (i368, etc) should I use for it, and what distro, the appropriate drivers, etc.

Desktop
Model: Emachine EL1200-05w
Processor: AMD Athlon 2650e Processor ( and on the sticker it says AMD Athlon at the top and 64 at the bottom)
Processor Speed: 1.61 GHz
RAM: 1GB
Graphics Card: Nividia GeForce 6150SE nForce 430 (integrated)
Graphics Memory: 512MB
Chipset: Nividia GeForce 6150SE nForce 430 (integrated)
(I believe most Linux Distros don’t have my chipset driver so Ethernet won’t work until it does)
System Type: I believe 32-bit but I don’t know how to check in XP

Laptop
Model: HP Pavilion dv6500
Laptop Processor: Intel® Pentium® Dual CPU T2330 @ 1.60GHz 1.60 GHz
Processor Speed: 2 processors with 1.60 GHz
Graphics: Some kind of Intel Graphics (integrated)
Graphics Memory: 128MB
Wireless: Some kind of Broadcom (integrated)
Chipset: Mobile Intel® 965 Express Chipset Family
System Type: 32 Bit

And I don’t know what is the best type to have it run off of. Because I have been having a few issues such as graphic issues and
